title: Paweł Morzywołek
text:
Theses

Master Thesis: Non-parametric Methods for Estimation of Hawkes Process for High-frequency Financial Data, ETH Zurich 2015.
Bachelor Thesis: Random Trees: Convergence of Discrete Random Trees to the Continuum Random Tree, ETH Zurich 2013.

title: Paweł Morzywołek
text:
Biography
I am a PhD student in statistical data analysis at Ghent University. In my research project, I apply methods from causal inference to infer the optimal time to initiate treatment in critically ill patients using observational routinely collected data.
I graduated with a mathematics degree from ETH Zurich with a focus on statistical learning theory and mathematical finance. Previously, I worked as a teaching assistant at African Institute for Mathematical Sciences (AIMS South Africa) and as an actuary and a data scientist in a consulting company EY.



Research interests

Causal inference
Semiparametric theory
Statistical machine learning
Applications in medicine




Education


MSc in Mathematics, 2015  ETH Zurich


BSc in Mathematics, 2014  ETH Zurich

title: Paweł Morzywołek
section: Teaching Assistant at AIMS South Africa
text:
Teaching Assistant at AIMS South Africa

Several short courses in mathematics, physics and computer science, e.g. “Introduction to Scientific Computing in Python”, “Problem Solving in Physics”, “Probability and Statistics”, “Algebra”. (Autumn Semester 2015)
